text: I got a DM asking what happened to the volatility in GameStop today and the goal of this video is to walk you through exactly that my hope is to try and help share more details on how we can interpret volatility from the options chain and review it for information and potentially some ideas on where the markets might be pricing and things to move options markets are very smart now another thing is if you haven't seen the video I put out earlier today on how to buy options smarter specifically in something like GameStop you should check that out I will throw it in the description below because volatility is such an important part of trading options and a lot of people got burned today because of that so let's do a quick recap on the 20th of June volatility was up to 247 per. this is very high and as we got closer into the expiration typically you will see volatility can do a bunch of different things but unless there's a perception of a big move that remains there typically you will see the expected move kind of contract volatility kind of contract because as there's less time there's typically a smaller expected range the way to think about that is if you were to guess about the total price range of GameStop over the next day or one 100 days which of those do you think would have a bigger price range 100 days

text: Kitty puts out something or if Cohen puts out something that gets everybody up and just moving like crazy this poses an insane risk for whoever is making the market in this product to get ran over into a close on expiration that's why for something like this you will see the volatility jacked up so freaking High because I call it a puncher's chance if you kind of like martial arts I'm a martial artist myself there's always a puncher chance you can be against somebody that's grossly skilled compared to you but if they have enough power one shot literally can knock you out it could be the luckiest shot on Earth and it can knock you out it's devastating you lose the fight you could win the entire fight and lose it right at the very end it's kind of the opposite of actually what happened with Holloway and gaii where Holloway won the entire fight and then at the end called him out for a slugfest which was awesome by the way back to this this is a pun's chance the reason why these are priced so expensively is because in the crazy off chance that there was a massive parabolic up move a market maker could get ran over by that order flow so that's why they jack up the implied volatility on these things so much and if we look on the put side it's even higher the putside is 11,900 absolutely chaos here
